title: Embedded Account Executive
description:
*Position at Confluent Europe Ltd.*
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day – we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.


One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.


Data Connects Us.**About the Role:**


Confluent is seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Embedded Sales Executive to drive revenue growth in EMEA. This role focuses on acquiring, building and managing strategic partnerships with Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Cloud Service providers to embed Confluent's streaming platform within their offerings. The successful candidate will be a proven sales professional with a strong track record of building revenue streams, specifically within the data infrastructure space.

**What You Will Do:**

* Drive ISV Embedded Sales Motion: Develop and execute a regional go-to-market strategy to identify key ISVs and CSPs that align with Confluent's strategic goals and focus on embedding Confluent within these companies
* Define Clear Objectives: Target segments, and key performance indicators (KPIs), and create targeted sales campaigns utilizing direct sales, digital marketing, and partner channels to drive awareness and interest in Confluent's embedded solutions.
* Execute and Close New Opportunities: Engage with key stakeholders within target organizations to understand their pain points and business objectives, presenting tailored solutions that demonstrate the value of embedding Confluent's platform.
* Negotiation: Negotiate terms and conditions to finalize partnership agreements, collaborate with internal teams for alignment on product capabilities and messaging, and provide ongoing support and resources to ensure partner success and smooth integration.
* Hunt for New Opportunities: Proactively prospect and develop a robust sales pipeline. Identify and qualify potential partners based on their market reach, technical capabilities, and alignment with Confluent's strategic objectives.
* Build Strategic Partnerships: Cultivate strong, long-term relationships with key decision-makers within target MSPs and cloud service providers. Negotiate mutually beneficial partnership agreements that drive revenue growth for both organizations.
* Evangelize Confluent's Platform: Clearly articulate the value proposition of Confluent's streaming platform to technical and business audiences within partner organizations. Showcase the benefits of embedding Kafka and Confluent for their customers.
* Develop Compelling Sales Presentations: Create and deliver persuasive presentations that highlight the revenue-generating potential of partnering with Confluent. Tailor presentations to the specific needs and priorities of each potential partner.
* Collaborate with Partners: Work closely with partner organizations to develop joint go-to-market plans, co-marketing initiatives, and sales enablement programs.
* Stay Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving data streaming landscape, emerging technologies, and competitive dynamics.

**What You Will Bring:**

* Proven Embedded Sales Experience: Demonstrated success in selling embedded software solutions, ideally within the data infrastructure, database, open source, messaging, or big data space. Specific experience working with MSPs and/or tertiary cloud service providers is highly preferred.
* Hunter Mentality: A proactive and results-oriented approach to sales with a proven ability to identify, qualify, and close new business opportunities.
* Strong Technical Acumen: A solid understanding of data streaming concepts, Kafka, and the Confluent platform. Ability to effectively communicate technical value to both technical and business audiences.
* Executive Presence: Confidence and credibility to engage with senior-level executives within partner organizations.
* Excellent Communication and Presentation Skills: Ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts and deliver compelling sales presentations.
* Strong Negotiation Skills: Proven ability to negotiate favorable partnership agreements that align with Confluent's business objectives.
* Experience in a High-Growth Environment: Prior experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup or high-growth technology company.
* Existing Relationships with MSPs and Cloud Service Providers (Preferred): Established network of contacts within the target partner ecosystem.

**Come As You Are**


At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.
company_description: Set Your Data in Motion. Your business is in motion. Now, you have a data platform for it. Confluent makes it easy to connect your apps, data systems, and entire organization with real-time data flows

title: Observability consultant-Grafana Expert
description:
Job Description
**J****ob Title:** **Observabili****ty consultant (****Grafana** **Expert)**


**Location:** **Helsingborg or Malmo,** **Sweden**


**Duration: 6-12 month contract**


**Working** **Mode: Hybrid**

  


**Job Description:**

**Background:**

  

  

Our Observability enablement team needs a consultant who will work closely with various Observability solutions.. We will be quite autonomous, self-organizing and self-sufficient in many ways, which means part of our daily work is to define how we get things done together.  

Help consumers acquire missing capabilities (around specific technical, or product related functionalities in the field of Observability) by bridging that/those capability gaps. E.g. by doing research, trying out options, making informed suggestions on adequate observability tooling, practices, frameworks..  

Proactively seek to understand the needs of consumers.  

Stay ahead of the curve in keeping abreast of new approaches and practices in their area of expertise, well before an actual need is expected from consumer.  

Be a developer advocate to the Observability platformpromoting, learning not only inside the enabling team, but across consumers, acting as a facilitator of knowledge sharing within the organization.


**The scope of the consultant** **services is to assist:**  

Proven experience as a Grafana expert with hands-on design and implementation of monitoring solutions.  

Ability to synthesize and communicate complex technical concepts and scenarios around observability..  

Skilled in Observability, managed as service using Grafana cloud or any similar.  

Be extremely knowledgeable about an emerging and rapidly growing technology by understanding, communicating, and documenting best practices.  

Ensure developers/consumers always get the help they need by providing brilliant documentation, thoughtful technical support, and fostering the tech community through the developer forum and Slack  

Make consumers lives easier by building and improving documentation, demos, scripts, integrations in the area of Observability.  

Ensure our offerings reflects the needs of the developers in our community by collecting feedback, logging bugs, and contributing to the product yourself  

Experience in growing and nurturing open source community projects.  

  

**Desired knowledge, experience, competence, skills** **etc****:**  

7+ years of experience of in the area of Observability and monitoring.  

Experience and profound knowledge in the LGTM stack, Loki for logs, Grafana for visualisation, Tempo for traces, and Mimir for metrics.  

Hands-on & practical experience of log aggregation related to Cloud Platforms, containerized (Docker, Kubernetes) deployments and CI/CD pipelines  

Experienced in using Git and knowledge about GitHub Copilot or other AI driven tools, and an awareness about it's pros and cons.  

Proficiency in Scripting, Automation and software programming.  

Experience in various observability toolsets and Observability best practices on SLO s SLIs (SRE concepts).  

Someone who wants to make their career progressed as an evangelist, developer advocate, DevRel Engineer,or anequivalent role.  

Strong Grafana knowledge and experience in evangelizing the same to our consumers  

Practical knowledge on monitoring and observability together with software development principles.  

Experience with event management products and cloud management at scale is beneficial.  

Ability to synthesize and communicate complex technical concepts and scenarios around observability.  

UpToDate knowledge with most of the Grafana cloud functionalities and features.

  


  

  

  

  

Skills
Proactive, Cloud Platforms, Documentation, Technical Support, Docker, Software Development, Grafana, Observability, LGTM, GIT, Scripting, Automation  

  

  

About Company
Axiom is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company and services provider. Our IT solutions empower organizations and individuals throughout the world to maximize value and quality to succeed in today's challenging business environment. As a fast-growing new economy company, we focus our strengths to offer world-class solutions and services through the convergence of technology, innovation, expertise and experience. We provide software consulting, development and IT-enabled services to clients across the globe. We work towards delivering sustained value creation for customers, employees, industries and society at large. Core offerings include data warehousing, middleware development, product development and web-enablement of legacy applications in verticals like telecom, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, energy & utilities, retail & distribution, enablement of legacy Relentless exploration of technology horizons and a Global Delivery Model that is a judicious combination of onsite, offsite and offshore development, offer a complete range of high-ROI business solutions spanning the consulting, technology, operations and process outsourcing value chain.


We are committed to providing solutions that are simple to use and cost-effective, that meet the specific set of needs defined, and that are adaptable to meet future needs.


Our aim is to work in partnership with our clients to deliver innovative and tailored solutions. Listening to and understanding your issues To deliver benefit—rapidly—to our clients. To create a unique customer focus, both in our relationships with our clients and in our approach. To use our world beating, innovative applications and methodologies to deliver high business value to our clients. Attaining senior level commitment to your project. Collaborative working and transparency. Building the right team for the job. Regular communication and documentation. Respecting the knowledge and experience of your staf.

title: Projektledare inom Data, Analytics & AI - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Är du passionerad för att utnyttja kraften i data och artificiell intelligens för att driva affärstransformationer? Har du erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsteam och leverera innovativa lösningar? Då ser vi framemot din ansökan! Vi söker en projektledare inom Data, Analytics och AI till Tietoevry Tech Services. Vi driver transformationer inom kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur på den nordiska marknaden.  

I rollen som Projektledare hos Tietoevry Tech Services kommer du att:* Leda projekt: Överse projekt från initiering till slutförande, säkerställa att leveransen sker i tid inom ramarna för omfattning och budget samt hantera dagliga verksamheten inklusive kommunikation och samarbete.
* Utveckling: Utveckla och implementera strategiska planer för data, analytics och AI-projekt i samarbete med våra kunder genom att använda moderna och framtidssäkra teknologier.
* Samarbeta: Arbeta nära kunder, partners och tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehoven och omvandla dem till tekniska lösningar.
* Mentorskap: Vägleda och utveckla teamet av talangfulla datavetare, analytiker och ingenjörer, främja professionell tillväxt och en samarbetsanda.
* Säkerställa Kvalitet: Upprätthålla höga kvalitetsstandarder i projektleveranser genom rigorösa test- och valideringsprocesser.
  

Positionen kräver inte omfattande resor, men vissa resor kan förekomma.  

Vem vi söker:* Erfarenhet: Erfarenhet av att leda projekt inom Data, Analytics och AI-området, gärna i en konsultmiljö.
* Expertis: Stark kunskap om dataanalysverktyg, ramverk och plattformar för data-, analytics- och AI-utveckling (t ex AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Ledarskap: Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda team och leverera framgångsrika projekt.
* Utbildning: Kandidat- eller magisterexamen inom datavetenskap, teknik, data science eller relaterat område.
* Kommunikation: Utmärkta kommunikations- och problemlösningsförmågor och förmågan att trivas i en snabbföränderlig miljö. Flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska.  

  

Vi erbjuder dig:
Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.  

Fick vi dig inspirerad?
Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Mikael Johansson, mikael.v.johansson@tietoevry.com.  

Hoppas vi hörs snart!
Plats: Stockholm *Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla* *slutkandidater.* *Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*  

Om Tietoevry
Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att utveckla digitala framtider där företag, samhällen och mänskligheten frodas.  

Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.  

Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Data Scientist/Data Analyst
description:
Summary
Data Scientist to Lowell  

  

We are looking for a Data Scientist/Data Analyst with the drive and passion to build, enhance, and maintain predictive models using the most appropriate statistical and machine learning methodologies.  

  

The Operations Analytics team is responsible for developing advanced analytics solutions to various Lowell’s business needs. As a Data Scientist, together with other seasoned data professionals in the team, you will contribute to the design and delivery of predictive models and get an opportunity to shape how advanced analytics will be applied in credit management.  

  

Apply as soon as possible as interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, the positions may be filled before the last application date Dec 23rd.  

  

Welcome with your application!
Job Description
Who we are:
Lowell is one of Europe's leading and most respected credit management companies, we believe in the importance of good relationships. Whether that’s with our customers or our people.
Together, we make credit work better for all! Our mission is to help customers on the path to becoming debt free; with a real focus on helping our customers pay off their debts in practical and affordable ways. We do this honestly, ethically and by treating our customers with dignity and respect.
Our focus on sustainability, hybrid working, leadership development and career progression makes working at Lowell a rewarding experience.
So that’s us, now let’s talk about your role…
Job description:
In your role as Data Scientist, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of advanced analytics models to different functions in the business and work closely with their departments in a variety of areas such as collection strategy, reforecasting and pricing.
Your close partnership with stakeholders across the business will give you valuable understanding of Lowell’s core business model and through close collaboration you will explore opportunities to drive significant value through employing advanced analytics models.
Who are you:
As Data Scientist you are intellectually curious, a critical thinker and have a naturally analytical mindset. You tolerate ambiguity and have a willingness to keep looking for better answers. You are enthusiastic, tenacious, and driven to tackle demanding goals. Your problem-solving skills and business acumen allow you to make significant contributions to the business.
We also expect the following qualifications:* Several years of experience working as a Data Scientist or similar role in complex analytics tasks
* Solid experience in building production-grade statistical and machine learning models
* Experience working in cloud environments, preferably in Microsoft Azure and Databricks
* A self-driven approach to solving problems and a willingness to take a high level of responsibility for the delivery of analytics projects
* A degree (B.Sc/M.Sc/Ph.D) in a quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, econometrics)
* Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R and SQL
* Good interactive skills and fluent proficiency in English (any Nordic language is a plus)
* The ability for independent planning and decision-making.


What we offer:
We welcome you to an exciting company with high goals and ambitions, which is constantly working to develop and challenge itself. We offer you a warm company climate, great colleagues and good benefits and working conditions. At Lowell, we have chosen to work in a hybrid model, which means that we work both in the office and from home. A little depending on the role and tasks of course.
Lowell is a value-driven company that lives by the values of Pioneering, Ambition, Compassion, Excellence, and Responsibility. These values are the foundation of Lowell's business and way of being and working. An exciting career is much more than just a salary. We also understand that everyone, regardless of culture, gender identity, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status, can contribute to our goal to make credit work better for all. Our strength is in our people.
company_description: Lowell is one of Europe’s largest credit management companies with a mission to make credit work better for all..

title: SQL Server DBA
description:
Are you a proactive technical expert passionate about optimizing and maintaining critical data infrastructure? ICA Banken is looking for a SQL Server DBA to take charge of our comprehensive MS SQL-based Data Warehouse, ensuring optimal performance, security, and seamless data integration. Join our dynamic Data Management team and drive innovations that connect data across systems for future-ready analytics.

 **About the role as SQL Server DBA**


As our SQL Server DBA, you will be the driving force behind the stability and efficiency of our MS Windows-based Data Warehouse environment. Your role encompasses:

* Maintaining and optimizing MS SQL databases, ensuring they are secure, compliant, and performant.
* Overseeing day-to-day operations, tackling incidents swiftly, and handling problem resolution.
* Coordinating the change management process.
* Facilitating smooth integration with internal and external systems.
* Supporting developers in resolving technical challenges and reviewing SQL code.
* Collaborating on strategic transformations, such as integrating with the ICA Google Cloud Platform to enable efficient data movement.
  

You will be interacting with several stakeholders and teams within ICA and be crucial in our transition towards a more interconnected, compliant, and efficient data ecosystem.

  

  

**We are looking for y****ou**


You bring extensive experience with MS SQL Server (versions 2016 or later) and related applications, like SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, and Visual Studio. You are skilled in:

* Managing SQL Agent Jobs, optimizing indexes, and improving stored procedures.
* Troubleshooting, performing data transfers, and refining table structures for performance.
* Familiarity with tools like Splunk, Red Gate, Kafka, Grafana, and Tableau is a plus.
  

You have relevant formal education or equivalent experience, and applicable Microsoft certifications and training. Strong English proficiency is essential, and experience in Data Warehouse design and the Banking & Insurance sector is beneficial. This role can be located at ICA Banken’s HQ in Borås or at the office in Solna.

  

If you are ready to elevate our data capabilities and make a significant impact, ICA Banken is the place for you!

 **Apply now**


Any kind of questions about the position contact hiring manager Johan Karlsson, Manager Data Analytics +4610 422 02 28, questions about the selection process or terms & conditions at ICA please contact recruiter Klara Himmelstrand, +4672 050 78 44. Apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2024-12-09.

 **About ICA Banken**


We are an everyday bank that lasts longer. We create personal, simple and affordable services for the ICA customer. Every day. Our business concept is to make everyday life a little easier for ICA's customers through financial services, as well as increase customers’ loyalty to ICA and reduce the ICA stores' and ICA AB's transaction costs for foreign banks and credit cards.


We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.

title: Tarento AB looking for SAP Integration Consultant
description:
**Qualifications:**  

Experience and expertise in multiple integration platforms like SAP Integration Suite, SAP PI/PO, MuleSoft, webMethods, Boomi etc
  
Experience into technology consulting, architecture and design focusing Enterprise Integration, SOA, Application Integration & Business to Business (B2B), Presales, Solutioning etc
  
Key expertise in providing Integration Modernization and recommendation of leading iPaaS products
  
Experience on Integration suite, SAP BTP Configuration in handling security artifacts, encryption, and decryption mechanisms and configuration of SSH keys.
  
Experience on configuration and extension of standard iFlows.
  
Good knowledge of API frameworks, ODATA & Integration via API’s.
  
Excellent skills on UDF, Groovy Script, On-cloud & On-premises implementation.
  
Experience with EDI integrations, API management.
  
Experience in PI to PO migration, PI/PO to Integration Suite migration, other platform migration
  
Good understanding of web methodologies, REST Architecture, SOA, ESB, APIs, Web services, XSD, WSDL, Open API, XML, JSON, EDIFACT, X.12, ABAP Proxy, OData, Flat file.
  
Protocols – AS2, HTTP(S), SOAP, JDBC, JMS. Mail, (S)FTP, SAP Adapters – IDoc, RFC, XI.
  
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills and an ability to help customers find the right solution.
  
Responsible for Excellent written and verbal communication from both business and technical perspectives
  
Collaborate with the team to drive innovation, share knowledge, and support each other.
  
  

Job description
  
An Integration specialist with an experience of working in at least 2 End-to-End Implementation. The role demands a strong background in Onshore Offshore models. Lead projects for the entire project life cycle from Customer Requirements to Delivery Execution. Be the customer face for Consulting assignments and have strong networking and collaboration skills. Enterprise and Digital journeys and lead their Integration journeys.
  
Understanding of both SAP Integrations and SAP Implementations, one Consultant covering both Integration and SAP back end configuration and development. Work and support both Enterprise middle wares like SAP PI/PO, Cloud Platform Integration, Business Connector, MuleSoft, WebSphere Message Broker, Web methods. Have the ability to learn and adapt to the Home Grown Enterprise Message Bus for Integrations with Backend Applications and other Enterprise middleware’s. Lead the product strategy and road map, help define priority and ensure execution of various road map features of home-grown Enterprise Message Bus. Define canonical and use those in Customer landscapes.
  
Define customer roadmap for Integrations including A2A and B2B. Understanding of Industry standard like EDI, XML, REST etc and ability to lead B2B Integrations. Understanding of Integration and SAP Upgrade lifecycles and define SAP Upgrades for Customers. Lead customers Application Maintenance and Operations team in a 24\*7 model with the offshore team and define SLAs and KPIs for both SAP Integration Platforms and SAP Applications.
  
Strong consulting and mine existing accounts, lead customer RFPs and sales cycles. Demonstrate leadership and mentorship skills to lead a remote team and ensure quality of delivery and execution.
  
  

About us
  
We are a Nordic-Indian company. Our headquarters is in Stockholm, Sweden. Our biggest unit and technology work is in Bangalore, India.
  
We take pride in combining the incredible dynamism and technology skills of India with the established order and efficiency of the Nordic countries.

title: IFS Business Consultant - Service & Asset (SWE)
description:
Om rollen I rollen som IFS Business Consultant inom Service & Asset kommer du att arbeta med att förbättra och effektivisera kundens service- och underhållsprocesser med stöd av IFS Applications och/eller IFS Cloud. Du arbetar tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett eller flera kundprojekt. Projekten är inriktade mot allt från implementering, uppgradering, utrullning mot nya länder och bolag samt förbättringsprojekt.
  
Tillsammans med kunden skapar du en förståelse för deras verksamhet och behov framåt. Utifrån din kunskap och erfarenhet inom det affärskritiska området kommer du att konsultera, utmana och komma med lösningsförslag till hur kunden på bästa sätt kan använda sig av IFS service- och underhållslösning. Kundens önskemål och krav tillsammans med dina rekommendationer och kunskaper översätts därefter till effektiva affärssystemslösningar.
  
Om dig Vad har du gjort tidigare då? Ja, vi tror att du kan ha erfarenhet från olika håll. Kanske har du en bakgrund som…
  
IFS konsult inom lösningsområdet Service & Asset men du kan likaväl haft en motsvarande roll i arbete med något annat system, så som Maximo, SAP, MS Dynamics 365, Pyramid eller M3.
  
Erfaren systemanvändare från ”kundsidan” inom IFS service- och underhållslösning. Med en titel som super user, processägare, systemägare eller liknande.
  
Eller så är du mycket kunnig inom verksamhetsområdet service/underhåll. Kanske innehar du en roll som servicekoordinator, underhållsplanerare, service-/underhållstekniker, fälttekniker eller liknande, med god vana och intresse för systemlösningar i jobbet. Du är helt enkelt en fena på vad våra kunder gör och förstår hur ett affärssystem kan stötta dem i sin vardag.
  
  

För att du ska passa och trivas hos oss är du en som ser möjligheter där andra ser problem. Dessutom är du en person som likt oss tror på vikten av att vara okomplicerad, tänka nytt, arbeta tillsammans och ha roligt på jobbet!
  
Varför Addovation Om du vill vara del av en mjuk men likväl affärsdriven organisation är Addovation något för dig. Hos oss är trivsel, utveckling och samarbete i fokus. Här kan du växa, påverka och ha roligt på jobbet samtidigt som du skapar värde för våra kunder.
  
Vi vet att flexibilitet skapar bättre balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi dig möjlighet till hybridarbete. Utöver detta erbjuder vi attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats att trivas på!
  
Det här är vi! Vi är ett nordiskt IT-bolag som är experter på affärs- och verksamhetslösningar som hjälper bolag att effektivisera sina processer. Utifrån kraftfulla systemplattformar som IFS, Oracle NetSuite och Microsoft 365 kan vi ta ett helhetsgrepp för att underlätta processerna inom våra kunders olika affärskritiska områden.
  
Team Addovation består idag av 200 rådgivare, experter och utvecklare som arbetar tillsammans för att skapa enkla och innovativa lösningar. Idag finns vi i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Sri Lanka.
  
Hur du ansöker! Låter detta som en tjänst som passar dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan via vår karriärssida. Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande.
  
För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterare Seline på seline.dietiker.vonk@addovation.com
  
Vi ser mycket fram emot din ansökan!

Lowell is one of Europe's leading and most respected credit management companies, we believe in the importance of good relationships. Whether that's with our customers or our people.
  
  

Together, we make credit work better for all! Our mission is to help customers on the path to becoming debt free; with a real focus on helping our customers pay off their debts in practical and affordable ways. We do this honestly, ethically and by treating our customers with dignity and respect.
  
  

Our focus on sustainability, hybrid working, leadership development and career progression makes working at Lowell a rewarding experience.
  
  

So that's us, now let's talk about your role…
  
  

**Job description:**  

In your role as Data Scientist, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of advanced analytics models to different functions in the business and work closely with their departments in a variety of areas such as collection strategy, reforecasting and pricing.
  
  

Your close partnership with stakeholders across the business will give you valuable understanding of Lowell's core business model and through close collaboration you will explore opportunities to drive significant value through employing advanced analytics models.
  
  

**Who are you:**  

As Data Scientist you are intellectually curious, a critical thinker and have a naturally analytical mindset. You tolerate ambiguity and have a willingness to keep looking for better answers. You are enthusiastic, tenacious, and driven to tackle demanding goals. Your problem-solving skills and business acumen allow you to make significant contributions to the business.
  
  

**We also expect the following qualifications:**  

* Several years of experience working as a Data Scientist or similar role in complex analytics tasks
* Solid experience in building production-grade statistical and machine learning models
* Experience working in cloud environments, preferably in Microsoft Azure and Databricks
* A self-driven approach to solving problems and a willingness to take a high level of responsibility for the delivery of analytics projects
* A degree (B.Sc/M.Sc/Ph.D) in a quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, econometrics)
* Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R and SQL
* Good interactive skills and fluent proficiency in English (any Nordic language is a plus)
* The ability for independent planning and decision-making.


**What we offer:**  

We welcome you to an exciting company with high goals and ambitions, which is constantly working to develop and challenge itself. We offer you a warm company climate, great colleagues and good benefits and working conditions. At Lowell, we have chosen to work in a hybrid model, which means that we work both in the office and from home. A little depending on the role and tasks of course.
  
  

Lowell is a value-driven company that lives by the values of Pioneering, Ambition, Compassion, Excellence, and Responsibility. These values are the foundation of Lowell's business and way of being and working. An exciting career is much more than just a salary. We also understand that everyone, regardless of culture, gender identity, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status, can contribute to our goal to make credit work better for all. Our strength is in our people.

title: IFS Business Consultant - Project (SWE)
description:
Om rollen
  
I rollen som IFS Business Consultant Projects kommer du att arbeta med kunder som bedriver sin verksamhet utifrån ett projektfokus. Du kommer att hjälpa dem att förbättra och effektivisera sina verksamhetsprocesser utifrån ett projektperspektiv med stöd av IFS Applications och/eller IFS Cloud. Du arbetar tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett eller flera kundprojekt. Projekten är inriktade mot allt från implementering, uppgradering, utrullning mot nya länder och bolag samt förbättringsprojekt.
  
Tillsammans med kunden skapar du en förståelse för deras verksamhet och behov framåt. Utifrån din kunskap och erfarenhet inom det affärskritiska området kommer du att konsultera, utmana och komma med lösningsförslag till hur kunden på bästa sätt kan använda sig av IFS projektlösning. Kundens önskemål och krav tillsammans med dina rekommendationer och kunskaper översätts därefter till effektiva affärssystemlösningar.
  
Din erfarenhet
  
Vad har du gjort tidigare då? Ja, vi tror att du kan ha erfarenhet från olika håll. Kanske har du en bakgrund som…
  
IFS-konsult inom lösningsområdet Projects men du kan likaväl ha haft en motsvarande roll i arbete med något annat system, så som SAP, Oracle Primavera, MS Projects,Deltek Maconomy eller liknande.
  
Erfaren systemanvändare från ”kundsidan” inom IFS Projects, med en titel som super user, processägare, systemägare eller annan relevant.
  
Eller så har du en gedigen bakgrund och erfarenhet av att arbeta i en projektstyrd verksamhet inom industrier så som bygg- och anläggning, telekom, tillverkning eller olja- och gas.
  
Oavsett är du väl insatt i och har god förståelse för systemstöd för projektrelaterade processer så som resursanskaffning (subcontracting & material), planering och rapportering av projekt, projektekonomi, materialflöden och uppföljning. Det är också en styrka om du har erfarenhet av andra affärsprocesser såsom försäljning, inköp, service och underhåll samt HCM.
  
  

Om dig
  
För att du ska passa och trivas hos oss är du en som ser möjligheter där andra ser problem. Dessutom är du en person som likt oss tror på vikten av att vara okomplicerad, tänka nytt, arbeta tillsammans och ha roligt på jobbet!
  
Varför Addovation
  
Om du vill vara del av en mjuk men likväl affärsdriven organisation är Addovation något för dig. Hos oss är trivsel, utveckling och samarbete i fokus. Här kan du växa, påverka och ha roligt på jobbet samtidigt som du skapar värde för våra kunder.
  
Vi vet att flexibilitet skapar bättre balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi dig möjlighet till hybridarbete. Utöver detta erbjuder vi attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats att trivas på!
  
Det här är vi!
  
Vi är ett nordiskt IT-bolag som är experter på affärs- och verksamhetslösningar som hjälper bolag att effektivisera sina processer. Utifrån kraftfulla systemplattformar som IFS, Oracle NetSuite och Microsoft 365 kan vi ta ett helhetsgrepp för att underlätta processerna inom våra kunders olika affärskritiska områden.
  
Team Addovation består idag av 200 rådgivare, experter och utvecklare som arbetar tillsammans för att skapa enkla och innovativa lösningar. Idag finns vi i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Sri Lanka.
  
  

Hur du ansöker!
  
Låter detta som en tjänst som passar dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan via vår karriärssida. Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande.
  
För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterare Seline på seline.dietiker.vonk@addovation.com
  
Vi ser mycket fram emot din ansökan!

title: Databasutvecklare till EPICO Tech
description:
**Databasutvecklare till EPICO Tech – ledande inom Oracle och moderna databaslösningar**  

  

Vill du arbeta i teknikens framkant och bidra till utvecklingen av några av marknadens mest komplexa och intressanta databaslösningar? **EPICO Tech** är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom Oracle-teknik, specialiserat på databasutveckling, prestandaoptimering och molnbaserade lösningar. Företaget söker nu en erfaren och engagerad databasutvecklare för att stärka sitt team och möta en ökande efterfrågan på sina tjänster.

  

**Om EPICO Tech**  

EPICO Tech har byggt upp ett starkt renommé som experter inom Oracle-teknologi och databaslösningar. Företaget arbetar med kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor, inklusive organisationer som **Tillväxtverket, E-hälsomyndigheten, Arbetsförmedlingen** och **ICA.**

  

Med kontor i centrala Stockholm tillämpar EPICO Tech en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell, där konsulter arbetar hos kund, från kontoret eller hemifrån. Konsulter hos EPICO har även möjlighet att utgå från andra delar av Sverige och söker särskilt konsulter i Sundsvall. EPICO Tech är en aktiv medlem i den svenska Oracle-användarföreningen (**SweOUG**) och är välkända för att bidra med expertis vid branschspecifika evenemang.


Hos EPICO Tech får konsulter möjlighet att arbeta i utmanande projekt som innefattar allt från prestandaanalyser och avancerad systemarkitektur till utveckling av moderna lösningar med **Oracle Apex**. Företaget är även starkt fokuserat på kompetensutveckling, genom såväl interna kunskapsutbyten som utbildningar och certifieringar.

 **Rollen som databasutvecklare**  

I rollen som databasutvecklare hos EPICO Tech kommer du att arbeta med lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för företag och organisationer. Du kommer att:


* Bidra till att lösa komplexa **prestandaproblem** och leverera strategiska förbättringar av kunders databaslösningar.
* Utveckla moderna system med hjälp av **Oracle Apex** och andra teknologier baserade på Oracle-plattformen.
* Arbeta i miljöer där molnlösningar som **Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)** och andra molnplattformar spelar en central roll.

Delta i interna samt externa tekniska workshops och bidra till kunskapsdelning både inom teamet och mot kunder.  
* 

**Kvalifikationer**  

EPICO Tech söker en erfaren och analytisk databasutvecklare med teknisk kompetens och en vilja att ständigt utvecklas.


Följande kvalifikationer är eftertraktade:

* Gedigen erfarenhet av **databasutveckling**, med kunskap i **PL/SQL**.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med **Oracle Apex**, eller en vilja att snabbt sätta dig in i det.
* God förståelse för **molnlösningar**, gärna inom **Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)** eller andra plattformar som **Azure**, **AWS** eller **Google Cloud**.
* Programmeringsvana i språk som **JavaScript, Python** eller liknande.

Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt på både svenska och engelska.  
* 

För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och bra på att bygga förtroende hos både kunder och kollegor.

 **Varför välja EPICO Tech?**  

Som en del av EPICO Tech erbjuds du en arbetsmiljö där teknisk spetskompetens möter en stark gemenskap. Företaget är känt för att leverera lösningar med hög kvalitet och för att skapa långsiktiga samarbeten med sina kunder. Genom sitt fokus på kompetensutveckling och samarbete erbjuder EPICO Tech en unik plattform för tekniskt kunniga personer som vill växa och bidra till branschens utveckling.

  

**Ansök idag!**  

Är du redo för en ny utmaning? Ansök till EPICO Tech och bli en del av ett team som ligger i framkant inom Oracle och moderna databasteknologier. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade lösningar, utvecklas professionellt och göra verklig skillnad.


Hoppas att vi har väckt ditt intresse och att du är nyfiken på att veta mer om rollen. Vi rekryterar löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart du kan. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten får du gärna kontakta oss på jobb@switchgame.se

 **Om Switch Game**  

Switch Game är rekrytering- och konsultbyrån som gör de krångliga enkelt, superenkelt. Genom att kombinera beprövade metoder med moderna arbetssätt och ny teknik kan vi hitta unika matchningar, snabbt och med hög träffsäkerhet. Vi arbetar alltid tvåvägs och söker kandidater till uppdrag såväl som uppdrag till kandidat vilket skapar en dynamisk organisation med många spännande möjligheter.

title: Network Security Consultant (Check Point)
description:
**About Integrity360**



Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.

  

What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

 **Job Role**



A Network Security Consultant is a specialized professional responsible for ensuring the security and integrity of an organization's computer networks and information systems. They work to protect against various cyber threats, including malware, hackers, and data breaches, by implementing robust security measures and best practices.

  


**Checkpoint expert** with strong knowledge of network infrastructure security on firewalls ,routers, switches and the associated network protocols and concepts is required.

  



Minimum of 5 year’s proven experience as a Network Security Engineer/Consultant with primary experience in Checkpoint with complementary experience with Fortinet and F5

 **Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**


* **Security Assessment and Analysis:**
	+ Evaluate existing network infrastructure for vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
	+ Conduct risk assessments to identify potential security threats and their impact.
	+ Understand firewall/load balancing/web proxy deployments, troubleshooting intrinsically.
	+ Analyse security logs and incidents to detect and respond to security breaches.

  

  



* **Security Strategy and Planning:**
	+ Develop and implement comprehensive network security strategies and policies.
	+ Recommend security solutions and technologies to address identified vulnerabilities or gaps.
	+ Create disaster recovery and incident response plans.

  

  



* **Firewall and Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS):**
	+ Configure, manage, and monitor firewall and IDS/IPS systems.
	+ Fine-tune rule sets to enhance network security and minimize false positives.

  

  



* **Security Infrastructure Deployment:**
	+ Install, configure, and maintain security appliances and software. Including firewalls, VPN Terminators,
	+ Load Balancers and Web Proxies.

  

  



* **Network Access Control:**
	+ Establish access control policies and mechanisms to control network access.
	+ Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.

  

  



* **Incident Response and Remediation:**
	+ Be available for escalation of security incidents. Contribute to root causes analysis, and recommend corrective actions.
	+ Coordinate with other IT teams to mitigate security breaches and recover compromised systems.

  

  



* **Documentation and Reporting:**
	+ Maintain accurate records of security configurations, incidents, and resolutions.
	+ Generate regular security reports for management and stakeholders.
	+ Present project and security reporting to internal and client management
  


**Required Skills**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field (Master's preferred).
* **Vendor certification/hands on experience with CheckPoint, Fortinet, F5, Zscaler, Ivanti Pulse Secure**
* Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CompTIA Security+, are considered a plus
* Proven experience in network security, with a deep understanding of network protocols and architectures.
* Strong knowledge of security tools and technologies, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPNs, and SIEM.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, NIST, ISO 27001).
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* A Network Security Consultant is crucial in maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of an organization's data and systems. They
* Play a pivotal role in proactively identifying and mitigating security risks to ensure business continuity and protect sensitive information.

  


**Working at Integrity360**



At Integrity360 we aim to reflect what’s important through the benefits we offer. We survey our people regularly and encourage discussions around these tops so we can understand what really makes a difference. Our benefits priorities are physical, mental and financial wellbeing.

  


**Mental & Physical wellbeing benefits:**


* Private healthcare provided by Attunda Hälsan
* Health insurance provided by Söderberg and Partners
* Onsite Gym (Kista office)
* SEK 5,000.00/year for Friskvårdbidrag, our allowance can be used for Gym memberships, to improve health and more!
  


**Financial wellbeing:**



We guarantee that every employee will have their pay reviewed at least once every year, if not more regularly. We aim to pay within the market range for all roles and keep pace with inflation on average.



What we offer:


* Twice yearly salary reviews
* Contributory Pension
* Income Protection
* Death-in-Service cover

  


**Other benefits include:**


* 30 days’ annual leave and options to carry over 5 days to the next financial year
* Our L&D program, we work with various platforms including Cybrary, Udemy, Preply, Pluralsight, Swift and HTB ensuring our people are up to date with their industry knowledge. Offering opportunities to further upskill and gain industry leading certifications.

  


**For more information, please contact** **HR@integrity360.com**
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: Project leader / GDL - Exterior Rear Lights
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**

  


It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------

  

At Exterior Systems you will be a key contributor to the next generation of Volvo Cars. Are you interested in connected car technology? Do you share our passion for people and urge to create a superior driving experience? Do you have a customer centric approach? Are you self-driven and communicative? Then you may be our new component project leader/ GDL. As the Project leader / GDL you will be part of a team that develop Exterior Rear Lights – mechatronic parts that very much expresses the design language of Volvo Cars. You will work in all phases from start until launch phase including customer quality validation.

  

  

You will gain a wide network across the different product development departments at Engineering and Design.  



**What you'll do**
------------------

  

• Establish the technical solution and align with stakeholders, in all phases of development including Advance Engineering as well as the project phase.  

* Closely cooperate with Suppliers, Design, and Procurement to reach the optimal legal solution.
* Secure the final product through quality-assuring actions such as FMEA, Design Reviews, and test planning.
* Secure that design prerequisites are developed in time and fulfilled during component sourcing.
* Follow up budget for the component development.
* Responsible for developing a part or subsystem according to predefined prerequisites (Technology, Time, and Cost) aligned with the vehicle program.
* Representative for my product area towards the program and the main interface towards the Department Program Manager.
* Leader of the cross functional program team, including supplier, for my product area.
* Lead the implementation of supplier-developed software.
* Lead the deliveries of the cross-functional team.
* Work according to VPDS (Volvo Product Development System), by using a technical logical plan.
* Ensure together with the Engineering Manager that the design reviews are conducted within the task.
  

**Personal Qualities**
----------------------

  

• Previous experience in leading sourcing activity including sourcing documentation.  

* Experience in software or hardware design for automotive.
* Ability to see the bigger picture of the technology we use today, tomorrow, and beyond.


• You are an inspiring and motivating leader that is great at driving your own tasks and supporting cross-functional teams to get things done according to a time plan.  

* Self-driven and a strong sense of curiosity.
* Responsive and positive attitude.
* Open-minded and eager to learn.
* Result-oriented and flexible.
* Structured with good documentation and communication skills.
* Good knowledge of planning your project and activities.
* Ability to work and thrive in an ambiguous environment.
* Good negotiation skills.
  

**Desired System knowledge**
----------------------------

  

• Pecca procost / Maxbom PCT  

* Vira and Confluence
* Teamcenter
* Carweaver/Systtem weaver
* KDP / TCPLM
* Cybersecurity
* System safety (Function safety)
  



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**

  


Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email.

  


  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  


Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: System Engineer with Functional Safety Background [F/M/X]
description:
**Who are we?**
---------------

**Amaris Consulting** is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.  

  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  

  

**Brief Call**: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  

  

**Interviews** (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  

  

**Case study**: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  

  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  

We look forward to meeting you!
**Job description**
-------------------

We are looking for a highly experienced and driven Systems Engineer with a background in Functional Safety. The perfect candidate is a skilled communicator, effective in planning and prioritizing tasks, results-oriented, and fluent in both written and verbal English. They also demonstrate solid technical leadership skills and work effectively in large organizations where decisions need to be made at multiple levels. The ideal candidate has a strong background in Functional Safety (FuSa), requirement breakdown and is proficient in standards such as ISO 26262, TARA, and HARA.



You will be working within the Traction Voltage System Management. TVSM is a key part of the electrical propulsion system, enabling a set of functions primarily focused on safety and core functionality. This role offers an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to be part of a growing organization and contribute to the transition toward a fossil-free propulsion system, where safety and quality are paramount. You will be analyzing, structuring, and defining system requirements for automotive applications, ensuring alignment with communication interfaces, FMEAs, and industry standards.

  


### **About you**

  


* Master of Science in Electronics, Data Science, Software Engineering, Mechatronics, or equivalent work experience.
* 10+ years of working experience within the field.
* Extensive experience in building automotive system solutions with requirements, communication interfaces, FMEAs, etc.
* Experience working with functional safety (ISO 26262) in automotive products and applications.
* Experience with propulsion systems in battery electric vehicles and knowledge of traction voltage systems/components is also highly valued.
* A genuine interest in safety functionality.
* Driven personality and capable of pushing tasks forward.
* Located in Europe.

### **What can you expect?**



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability or other characteristics.
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Production Manager Cotton and Pulp Preparation
description:
**Crane Currency has an immediate position opening for a** **Production Manager, Cotton and Pulp Production** **Based out of** **TUMBA.**
=========================================================================================================================================


**Who we are:**
===============



Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.


**How you will make an impact:**
================================



You will lead a team of professionals in our cotton and pulp preparation, a crucial part of the bank note paper making process. Your team will respond to your ability to motivate and inspire others to achieve our daily goals related to safety, quality, delivery, cost and growth.


Our external customers look to you and your team to build the products that their economies need. Colleagues will benefit from your structured and goal-oriented way of working. You will report to the Managing Director and be instrumental in developing and driving strategic plans for the department.

  




**Other responsibilities:**
===========================


* Achieve long- and short-term goals according to Business plan and budget goals for the department.


* Department responsibility for a Supervisor, Production Engineer, Process Engineer and 27 operators.
* Ensure that deviations related to Safety, Quality, delivery, cost and growth are managed within the department.
* Ensure collaboration with other departments to achieve Pulp and Cotton Production goals.


* Delegate work environment task responsibilities and manage systematic work environment processes to maintain a safe and productive workplace.


* Ensure an effective Organizational Structure, continuously develop employees in accordance with current regulations, providing training and growth opportunities to enhance their skills and performance.

  


**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**
===========================================================


**Required:**


* Master of science in engineering or chemistry or commensurate experience.
* 10 years’ experience working in the process/paper industry.
* 5 years’ experience in a supervisory position or as a manager
* Very good written and spoken knowledge of the English and Swedish language.
* Good computer skills.


**Preferred:**


* Experience working with lean and continuous improvement.
* Results-driven and organized: Demonstrates a strong focus on achieving goals and maintaining a systematic approach to tasks.
* Strong prioritization skills: Effectively identifies and concentrates on the most critical tasks to ensure optimal productivity.
* Experience with multi-year strategic planning: Skilled in developing and executing long-term plans to achieve organizational objectives.
* Excellent leadership and direction: Provides clear guidance and inspires teams to perform at their best

  


**How we will care for you:**
=============================


* Top-notch medical benefits – We take care of you with our wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care.
* Personal development – We want you to grow with us. Through lunch & learns, career ladders and more.
* Community Engagement – Give yourself time to support the local community and environment through volunteer events and on-site initiatives to benefit local communities and organizations.
* There’s more – Competitive compensation , vacation, parental leave, and retirement plans.

  


**What drives our team:**
=========================



We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:


* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


People are at the center of all that we do, from our employees to our customers and our communities. We empower our teams to help shape the Crane Currency experience, embracing and celebrating our unique perspectives and differences to learn from each other and grow stronger together. To learn more about life at Crane Currency, visit www.cranecurrency.com.


**Where we are:**
=================



Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, 10 -minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. title: Production Manager Cotton and Pulp Preparation
description:
**Crane Currency has an immediate position opening for a** **Production Manager, Cotton and Pulp Production** **Based out of** **TUMBA.**
=========================================================================================================================================


**Who we are:**
===============



Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.


**How you will make an impact:**
================================



You will lead a team of professionals in our cotton and pulp preparation, a crucial part of the bank note paper making process. Your team will respond to your ability to motivate and inspire others to achieve our daily goals related to safety, quality, delivery, cost and growth.


Our external customers look to you and your team to build the products that their economies need. Colleagues will benefit from your structured and goal-oriented way of working. You will report to the Managing Director and be instrumental in developing and driving strategic plans for the department.

  




**Other responsibilities:**
===========================


* Achieve long- and short-term goals according to Business plan and budget goals for the department.


* Department responsibility for a Supervisor, Production Engineer, Process Engineer and 27 operators.
* Ensure that deviations related to Safety, Quality, delivery, cost and growth are managed within the department.
* Ensure collaboration with other departments to achieve Pulp and Cotton Production goals.


* Delegate work environment task responsibilities and manage systematic work environment processes to maintain a safe and productive workplace.


* Ensure an effective Organizational Structure, continuously develop employees in accordance with current regulations, providing training and growth opportunities to enhance their skills and performance.

  


**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**
===========================================================


**Required:**


* Master of science in engineering or chemistry or commensurate experience.
* 10 years’ experience working in the process/paper industry.
* 5 years’ experience in a supervisory position or as a manager
* Very good written and spoken knowledge of the English and Swedish language.
* Good computer skills.


**Preferred:**


* Experience working with lean and continuous improvement.
* Results-driven and organized: Demonstrates a strong focus on achieving goals and maintaining a systematic approach to tasks.
* Strong prioritization skills: Effectively identifies and concentrates on the most critical tasks to ensure optimal productivity.
* Experience with multi-year strategic planning: Skilled in developing and executing long-term plans to achieve organizational objectives.
* Excellent leadership and direction: Provides clear guidance and inspires teams to perform at their best

  


**How we will care for you:**
=============================


* Top-notch medical benefits – We take care of you with our wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care.
* Personal development – We want you to grow with us. Through lunch & learns, career ladders and more.
* Community Engagement – Give yourself time to support the local community and environment through volunteer events and on-site initiatives to benefit local communities and organizations.
* There’s more – Competitive compensation , vacation, parental leave, and retirement plans.

  


**What drives our team:**
=========================



We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:


* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


People are at the center of all that we do, from our employees to our customers and our communities. We empower our teams to help shape the Crane Currency experience, embracing and celebrating our unique perspectives and differences to learn from each other and grow stronger together. To learn more about life at Crane Currency, visit www.cranecurrency.com.


**Where we are:**
=================



Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, 10 -minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Tumba is a small suburb in an area with different cultures from all corners of the world. The area offers a beautiful landscape and countryside feeling. You can spend the day to explore the shopping mall nearby, enjoy the surrounding nature, or take the train into the vibrant pulse of Stockholm City to enjoy the many restaurants, shopping, sightseeing and stroll through beautiful Downtown, Gamla Stan.



-

title: Software Verification Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 5+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

Description of the assignmentAs a Software Verification Engineer, you are responsible for the verification of Power Supply System at BaseFunction Verification Team. Working closely together with the high voltage and low voltage system design teamsin EU.• Perform components, system, and function level of testing in high voltage and low voltage power supplysystem.• Design test methods and approaches based on area requirements and specifications.• Collaborate with team in China and Sweden.• Document and report test results.• Analyze faults, document root causes and communicate findings to relevant design teams. Qualifications and skills required for the role•B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or a related field.• 5+ years of experience in verification within automotive environment.• Proficient with Vector tools for simulation and communication measurement (CAN, CAN FD, LIN,FlexRay, Ethernet Automotive).• Knowledge of Unified Diagnostic Service (UDS) – ISO 14229 and experience with diagnostic tools.• Skilled in writing DVMs (Design verification methods).• Hands-on experience with automotive test in both vehicle and rig environments.• Strong understanding of High and Low Voltage Power Distribution Systems.• Valid Swedish driver’s license. Personal attributes: • Willingness to travel within Europe and China (approx. 4 - 6 trips per year).• Strong leadership, motivational and persuasive skills.• High level of responsibility, autonomy, and self-management within the team.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Technical Support Engineer in Embedded Software
company: アイエーアール・システムズ株式会社
description:
With our world-leading software and services, IAR enhance developer productivity in embedded development and security, empowering customers globally to innovate and secure today's products and tomorrow's innovations. As an Embedded Software Support Engineer, help us empower embedded developers worldwide, assisting them in overcoming technical challenges and ensuring they make the most out of our products.
  
  

**More than just support:** A deep dive into technical challenges
  
You will become part of our EMEA Technical Support team, which is part of IAR's global Customer Success organization. This is an opportunity to dive deep into technical challenges alongside a team that has a passion for technology, problem-solving, and customer service, as well as they enjoy our daily afternoon fika, where we discuss everything from technical insights to weekend plans.
  
At IAR, our Technical Support team is unique. Here, experienced engineers, some with backgrounds as developers, work together, meaning they truly understand the real challenges our customers face. Along with your team, you’ll have the chance to apply and further develop your technical knowledge while making a difference for embedded developers around the world.
  
  

As Technical Support Engineer at IAR…
  
You will work closely with our customers, who are embedded developers, to help them overcome technical challenges and enhance their projects using our technology– always with the goal of creating genuine customer success.
  
Your main focus will be on handling first-line customer contact and conducting technical investigations in Back Office, primarily via email, but you will also have e-meetings with customers when required. You will monitor support requests from IAR’s customers, diagnose issues, and work towards resolutions. In addition, you will ensure compliance with the support and update agreement (SUA) by conducting error investigations, reporting bugs, and creating and delivering technical materials and additional services to our customers.
  
You get the chance to collaborate with various teams within IAR, especially in projects like IAR Embedded Academy, where we provide our customers with the training and tools they need to enhance their use of our products. By combining your technical focus with a strong service mindset, you will have the opportunity to influence how we deliver value to our customers and ensure their success.
  
  

**We think you have:**  

A degree in computer science, embedded systems, or a related engineering field.
  
Proficiency in C/C++ programming languages.
  
Previous experience in embedded development.
  
Experience using debugger tools for embedded software.
  
Knowledge of RTOS and Linux.
  
Strong written and spoken communication skills in English.
  
  

**A bonus if you have:**  

Previous experience working directly with customers or clients.
  
Previous knowledge of CI/CD
  
Proficiency in Swedish and/or another European language, both written and spoken.
  
  

Your future at IAR
  
Many of our support engineers have historically advanced to join our engineering teams, leveraging the technical expertise and customer insights gained in the support role.
  
We encourage and support internal growth, and you will have the chance to explore opportunities within the company and we welcome and value your aspirations. At IAR, you will not only develop your skills but also have the opportunity to shape your own career path.
  
Apply today!
  
Interviews are being conducted continuously, so please apply today! If you have any questions about the role or the process, don't hesitate to contact Linnéa Sjuls at linnea.sjuls@iar.com.
  
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: 2025 Graduate Software Dev Engineer
description:
* Graduated less than 24 months ago or about to complete a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application
* Although no specific programming language is required – you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++, or Python
* Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis.


Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle?
  
  

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA.
  
  

Our Software Development Engineers (SDEs) use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand.
  
  

If this is you, come chart your own path at Amazon!
  
  

The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and impact millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We’re looking for individuals who are excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.
* Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
* Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
* Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
* Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software.
* Previous technical internship(s) if applicable
* Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases
* Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation
* Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
* Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly.


EMEA Student Programs Team
  
  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
  
  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
